intro: Santanderella amadorinconiana, commonly known as the Amador inconic plant, is a rare flowering plant native to the Andean region of Colombia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in an umbel, typical of its family. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in cloud forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
